column1: Desio (Milanese: Desii) is a town and comune in the Province of Monza and Brianza
In 1277 it was the location of the battle between the Visconti and della Torre families for the rule of Milan. On 24 February 1924
column2: Desio received the honorary title of city with a royal decree.

column1: It is also known as the birthplace of Pope Pius XI and of Marco Sportiello
In 1944 the opera singer Giuseppina Finzi-Magrini was killed in an American air raid on Desio.
Desio is served by Desio railway station.
